problem_text:
∗19.63. Let A = {Ar | r ∈ Φ} be an elementary carpet of type Φ over a commutative ring K (see 7.28) and let A^2_r = {t^2 | t ∈ Ar}. Are the inclusions A^2_r A−r ⊆ Ar, r ∈ Φ, sufficient for the carpet A to be closed (admissible)?
Ya. N. Nuzhin
answer: Yes, they are sufficient (Ya. N. Nuzhin, J. Siberian Fed. Univ. Ser. Math. Phys., 16, no. 6 (2023), 732–737; Ya. N. Nuzhin, to appear in Siberian Math. J.).
